sentences.en: Both sides have tried to outdo each other to show how tough they can be.
sentences.cn: 双方各不相让，都想显示自己有多么厉害。

sentences.en: Competitive spirit is the desire to outdo running mates.
sentences.cn: 竞技精神是指渴望胜过对手.

sentences.en: He tried to outdo his opponents.
Holly: Not to outdo you, Taylor, but I have something to say, too.
sentences.cn: 荷莉: 不是要把你比下去, 泰勒, 但是我也有话要说.

sentences.en: If I keep on practicing, I believe I can outdo my father someday.
sentences.cn: 我想如果我继续锻炼, 总有一天会超过爸爸的.

sentences.en: It was important for me to outdo them, to feel better than they were.
sentences.cn: 超过他们，感到自己比他们更优秀，这点对我来说很重要。

sentences.en: Jigme noticed that this made the Sang work harder, trying to outdo the dumb beast.
sentences.cn: 吉美注意到这使得桑人登得更卖力, 想要超过这不能说话的牲畜.

sentences.en: My admiration for them aroused the fight within me, a person always eager to outdo others.
sentences.cn: 在对他们羡慕的同时我心中那股好强的斗志被猛烈的激起.

sentences.en: Now it thinks it can outdo them.
sentences.cn: 现在,中国又认为可以超越这些大资本家.

sentences.en: She emulously tried to outdo her older sister.
sentences.cn: 她试图在竞争中超过姐姐.

sentences.en: Sometimes small firms can outdo big business when it comes to customer care.
sentences.cn: 在顾客服务方面，有时小企业可能优于大企业。

sentences.en: The effects of psychological balance outdo all health measures.
sentences.cn: 心理平衡的作用超过所有的“保健“措施.

sentences.en: The plaster became thicker and thicker as the kings sought to outdo each other conspicuous consumption.
sentences.cn: 各地领主都想在与别的王侯的争奇斗富中胜出,于是,灰泥涂抹得越来越厚,越来越厚.

sentences.en: When it comes to speed of response, a small firm can outdo a big company.
sentences.cn: 说到反应速度，小公司会胜过大公司。

phrases.tran_cn: 尽自己最大努力；超过自己原来水平

trans.tran_en: to be better or more successful than someone else at doing something
to be better or more successful than someone else at doing something
